~~~ scala
doc / scalacOptions ++= Seq("-versions-dictionary-url", "https://dotty.epfl.ch/versions.json")
~~~

## Providing settings

comments.body: In general, I would suggest showing the example before showing the syntax reference.
By the way, I am a bit confused that the syntax to supply some options is `-setting value`, and sometimes `-setting:value`. Would it make sense to use a uniform syntax?

As far as I know, every setting should be -setting:value
@pikinier20, could you bring some more insight?
`-external-mappings` is a setting of type `Setting[List[String]]` and AFAIK the syntax for such settings is `-setting:(value,)*value` (at least we use this syntax for all settings in scaladoc)

Example external mapping is:
`-external-mappings:.*scala.*::scaladoc3::http://dotty.epfl.ch/api/,.*java.*::javadoc::https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/`

A mapping is of the form '\<regex>::\[scaladoc3|scaladoc|javadoc]::\<path>'. You can supply several mappings, separated by commas, as shown in the example.
